metadata.title: CVE-2017-15389 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An insufficient watchdog timer in navigation in Google Chrome prior to62.0.3202.62 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents of the Omnibox(URL bar) via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.14.04.1204
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.14.04.1204
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.14.04.1204
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.14.04.1204
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.14.04.1204
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.14.04.1204').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
